author: Gonzalo Blázquez de Sande
title: Ana Peleteiro y su mensaje de aliento al Celta: "Hasta el final"
text: El mensaje de aliento de Ana Peleteiro al Celta de Vigo: "Las peleas se luchan hasta el final” - La atleta gallega dejó en ElDesmarque un mensaje de fuerza para el Celta de Vigo - A pesar de no estar muy puesta en el fútbol, conoce la situación del equipo vigués - [Ana Peleteiro jugará en la Kings League](https://www.eldesmarque.com/futbol/kings-league/20240312/ana-peleteiro-kings-league-atleta_300272518.html#utm_source=sumario&utm_medium=articulo) La alfombra roja de los Premios Ídolo ha reunido a muchas personalidades de la actualidad de nuestro país. Desde los nombres más concidos del mundo streamer, pasando por los influencers más populares y llegando a deportistas de lo más top. [Ilia Topuria, el campeón del mundo de la UFC](https://www.eldesmarque.com/otros-deportes/mma-artes-marciales-mixtas/20240314/leccion-ilia-topuria-alfombra-roja-premios-idolo-creer-crear-realidades_300275438.html), no se ha querido perder la cita, como tampoco lo ha hecho [la atleta ](https://www.eldesmarque.com/otros-deportes/atletismo/20240307/premonicion-ana-peleteiro-juegos-olimpicos-paris-2024-estar-broma_300267416.html) [Ana Peleteiro](https://www.eldesmarque.com/otros-deportes/atletismo/20240307/premonicion-ana-peleteiro-juegos-olimpicos-paris-2024-estar-broma_300267416.html), que ha aprovechado el momento para enviar un mensaje al Celta de Vigo a través de las cámaras de ElDesmarque. [La recién proclamada bronce en los Campeonatos del Mundo](https://www.eldesmarque.com/otros-deportes/atletismo/20240303/lagrimas-ana-peleteiro-orgullo-marido-grada-gesta-mujer-guerrera_300263600.html) de Atletismo de Glasgow en Triple Salto ha desfilado por la alfombra roja de los premios organizados por Aida Domenech, más conocida como Dulceida. Allí, Peleteiro ha reconocido que no está muy puesta en el mundo del fútbol. “No me da la vida. Entre el atletismo, mi hija, mi familia, hace mucho que no veo fútbol”, admitía. Pero el relevo en el banquillo del Celta de Vigo sí le ha llegado a la deportista. “Lo ví ayer en Instagram”, reconocía. “Vi que se ha ido Benítez y que ha entrado un chico nuevo”, explicaba en referencia a [Claudio Giraldez, el nuevo técnico celeste.](https://www.eldesmarque.com/futbol/celta-de-vigo/20240314/cuerpo-tecnico-claudio-giraldez-oubina-psicologo_300274693.html) “A ver si va un poquito mejor, porque sí que sé que el Celta, este año, va un poco mal. A ver si remontamos”, expresaba la de Ribeira ante el micrófono de ElDesmarque. Las motivadoras palabras de Ana Peleteiro hacia el celtismo La saltadora de triple salto española ha querido mandar un mensaje de aliento al equipo de Vigo. “Mucho ánimo y que las peleas se luchan hasta el final”, arrancaba entonando la deportista. “La liga aún no ha acabado y aún se puede luchar”, deslizaba la protagonista. Ahora mismo, el Celta de Vigo se encuentra en decimoséptima posición. El cuadro gallego marca los puestos de permanencia con 24 puntos, solo dos por encima del Cádiz, el primer equipo del descenso. La llegada del nuevo entrenador desde el filial pretende actuar como revulsivo en el equipo, para coger aire y poner distancia desde esta misma jornada con las posiciones más peligrosas. Para ello, Giraldez empezará su aventura al frente del cuadro vigués visitando al Sevilla en el Ramón Sánchez Pizjuán. Peleteiro, ilusionada de cara a París 2024 Después del éxito que ha obtenido en su vuelta a las pistas –tras su maternidad–, Ana tiene entre ceja y ceja la importante competición que llega este verano, los Juegos Olímpicos de París. La atleta ya tiene el billete para viajar a la capital francesa y la ilusión es máxima en el camino a las medallas. “Super contenta. No solo por las marcas, sino por la competición. Estoy muy feliz y eso se transmite en la pista”, manifestaba la profesional. “Creo que es el inicio de mi mejor versión”, pronunciaba en un motivador mensaje Ana. “Después de este mundial, no puedo pensar de otra forma. Así que a por todas en París”, afirmaba a ElDesmarque.

author: @morungexpress05
title: Viswema Youth Organisation 77th sports meet begins | MorungExpress | morungexpress.com
text:
Vitsorel Lcho and others during 77th Sports Meet 2025 of VYO at Viswema on January 16. (Morung Photo)
Our Correspondent
Kohima | January 16
A three-day long 77th Sports Meet 2025 of Viswema Youth Organisation (VYO) commenced at John Government Higher Secondary School Ground & Multipurpose Hall, Tewetsoi-Ozwü, Sweba, Viswema village on January 16.
Four khels of Viswema-Kirha, Pavo, Rachü and Zheri are competing in Football, Volleyball and Sepaktakraw.
Gracing the inaugural session, Vitsorel Lcho, Member, Nagaland State Consumer Dispute Redressal Commission encouraged the sportsperson to be hardworking, dedicated and disciplines in order to excel in any discipline.
Maintaining that sports has become a very lucrative profession with players in different disciplines earning more than that of a businessman or service personnel, he said that both the Centre and State governments are giving importance to create opportunities for the young talents and also development of sporting infrastructure.
Lcho suggested that young players should not try to be jack of all trades but identify their talent and concentrate only in one potential sporting discipline in order to excel and become professional players in the future.
Lcho also called upon the sportsperson to abstain from intoxicants to remain healthy and also make a humble beginning as a sportsperson and move from amateur to professional sportsperson.
The inaugural programme was chaired by VYO Vice President, Chothavi Mekro while VYO Games & Sports Secretary, Puzakhwezo Khanyü administered oath to the participating teams.

organizations.name: John Government Higher Secondary School Ground & Multipurpose Hall
Nagaland State Consumer Dispute Redressal Commission

author: @francophileenoz
title: Severe Thunderstorms Forecast for East Coast | Illawarra Mercury | Wollongong, NSW
text: After bouts of wild weather over Christmas, the east coast will face another round of severe thunderstorms and rain according to the Bureau of Meteorology's (BoM) latest forecast. Severe thunderstorms have eased across eastern Australia but are expected to redevelop around eastern Queensland and northeast NSW from December 30 into the New Year. Parts of Australia are set to face wet and potentially wild weather on New Years Eve and New Year's Day. BoM senior meteorologist Sarah Scully said isolated thunderstorms are possible for parts of Queensland, NSW, Victoria and South Australia. "Severe thunderstorms are possible in Queensland between St Lawrence and Redcliffe, although activity will not be as widespread compared to previous days," Ms Scully said. "Isolated gusty thunderstorms are also possible over western South Australia." Showers and storms are possible across parts of southern and eastern Australia, mainly NSW, eastern South Australia, and northern Victoria on December 29. There is a risk of severe thunderstorms in Sydney, the Blue Mountains and the Hunter regions. Severe thunderstorms will become more widespread from this weekend concentrating in north-east NSW, and south-east and central Queensland. BoM said there are indications that isolated, very dangerous thunderstorms with destructive winds, giant hail and intense rainfall may be possible across southeast Queensland on Saturday. BoM has encouraged the community to stay up to date with the latest forecasts and warnings using the BOM Weather app and website. Queensland will also experience heatwave conditions along the east coast affecting Brisbane, the Sunshine Coast and areas surrounding Cairns. Northern and Western Australia will also face heatwave conditions with temperatures reaching the mid to high 40 degree Celsius in some areas. Sign up for our newsletter to stay up to date. We care about the protection of your data. Read our [Privacy Policy](/privacy/).

author: StockTitan
title: $250M Mother-Son Team Joins LPL Financial from Edward Jones, Thrivent | LPLA Stock News
text:
LPL Financial Welcomes ProsperLane Financial
LPL Financial (NASDAQ:LPLA) has announced that ProsperLane Financial, a mother-son team managing approximately $250 million in assets, has joined LPL's broker-dealer and RIA platform. The team consists of Sheri Johnston, CFP® (formerly with Edward Jones) and Jason Hotzler (previously with Thrivent Investment Management), who together bring over 25 years of experience.
Based near Minneapolis, ProsperLane Financial specializes in serving young professionals, small businesses, and family-run firms. The team chose LPL for its enhanced technology offerings and succession planning support. LPL Financial currently supports over 29,000 financial advisors and approximately 1,200 financial institutions, with approximately $1.8 trillion in brokerage and advisory assets under management.
LPL Financial (NASDAQ:LPLA) ha annunciato che ProsperLane Financial, un team composto da madre e figlio che gestisce circa 250 milioni di dollari in asset, si è unito alla piattaforma broker-dealer e RIA di LPL. Il team è formato da Sheri Johnston, CFP® (precedentemente presso Edward Jones) e Jason Hotzler (in precedenza con Thrivent Investment Management), che insieme vantano oltre 25 anni di esperienza.
Con sede nei pressi di Minneapolis, ProsperLane Financial si specializza nel servire giovani professionisti, piccole imprese e aziende familiari. Il team ha scelto LPL per le sue avanzate soluzioni tecnologiche e il supporto nella pianificazione della successione. Attualmente, LPL Financial supporta oltre 29.000 consulenti finanziari e circa 1.200 istituzioni finanziarie, gestendo circa 1,8 trilioni di dollari in asset di intermediazione e consulenza.
LPL Financial (NASDAQ:LPLA) ha anunciado que ProsperLane Financial, un equipo compuesto por madre e hijo que administra aproximadamente 250 millones de dólares en activos, se ha unido a la plataforma broker-dealer y RIA de LPL. El equipo está formado por Sheri Johnston, CFP® (anteriormente en Edward Jones) y Jason Hotzler (antes en Thrivent Investment Management), quienes juntos aportan más de 25 años de experiencia.
Con sede cerca de Minneapolis, ProsperLane Financial se especializa en atender a jóvenes profesionales, pequeñas empresas y negocios familiares. El equipo eligió LPL por sus avanzadas ofertas tecnológicas y apoyo en la planificación de sucesión. Actualmente, LPL Financial respalda a más de 29,000 asesores financieros y aproximadamente 1,200 instituciones financieras, con cerca de 1.8 billones de dólares en activos de corretaje y asesoría bajo gestión.
LPL Financial (NASDAQ:LPLA)는 약 2억 5천만 달러의 자산을 관리하는 모자 팀인 ProsperLane Financial이 LPL의 브로커-딜러 및 RIA 플랫폼에 합류했다고 발표했습니다. 이 팀은 Sheri Johnston, CFP® (이전에는 Edward Jones 소속)와 Jason Hotzler (이전에는 Thrivent Investment Management 소속)로 구성되어 있으며, 두 사람은 합쳐서 25년 이상의 경험을 보유하고 있습니다.
미니애폴리스 인근에 기반을 둔 ProsperLane Financial은 젊은 전문가, 소규모 기업 및 가족 경영 기업을 전문으로 합니다. 이 팀은 향상된 기술 제공과 승계 계획 지원 때문에 LPL을 선택했습니다. 현재 LPL Financial은 29,000명 이상의 금융 자문가와 약 1,200개의 금융 기관을 지원하며, 약 1.8조 달러 규모의 중개 및 자문 자산을 관리하고 있습니다.
LPL Financial (NASDAQ:LPLA) a annoncé que ProsperLane Financial, une équipe mère-fils gérant environ 250 millions de dollars d'actifs, a rejoint la plateforme courtier-négociant et RIA de LPL. L'équipe est composée de Sheri Johnston, CFP® (anciennement chez Edward Jones) et Jason Hotzler (précédemment chez Thrivent Investment Management), qui cumulent plus de 25 ans d'expérience.
Basée près de Minneapolis, ProsperLane Financial se spécialise dans le service aux jeunes professionnels, aux petites entreprises et aux sociétés familiales. L'équipe a choisi LPL pour ses offres technologiques améliorées et son soutien à la planification successorale. LPL Financial soutient actuellement plus de 29 000 conseillers financiers et environ 1 200 institutions financières, avec environ 1,8 billion de dollars d'actifs en courtage et gestion conseillée.
LPL Financial (NASDAQ:LPLA) hat bekannt gegeben, dass ProsperLane Financial, ein Mutter-Sohn-Team, das etwa 250 Millionen US-Dollar an Vermögenswerten verwaltet, sich der Broker-Dealer- und RIA-Plattform von LPL angeschlossen hat. Das Team besteht aus Sheri Johnston, CFP® (zuvor bei Edward Jones) und Jason Hotzler (zuvor bei Thrivent Investment Management), die zusammen über 25 Jahre Erfahrung verfügen.
Mit Sitz in der Nähe von Minneapolis spezialisiert sich ProsperLane Financial auf die Betreuung junger Berufstätiger, kleiner Unternehmen und familiengeführter Firmen. Das Team entschied sich für LPL aufgrund der verbesserten Technologieangebote und der Unterstützung bei der Nachfolgeplanung. LPL Financial unterstützt derzeit über 29.000 Finanzberater und rund 1.200 Finanzinstitute mit etwa 1,8 Billionen US-Dollar an verwalteten Brokerage- und Beratungsvermögen.
- None.
- None.
SAN DIEGO, July 30, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- LPL Financial LLC announced today that mother and son team, Sheri Johnston, CFP® and Jason Hotzler, from ProsperLane Financial have joined LPL Financial’s broker-dealer, Registered Investment Advisor (RIA). They reported serving approximately
Based outside of Minneapolis in Prior Lake, Minn., Johnston and Hotzler have over 25 years of experience. They focus on serving young professionals who can grow into long-term clients, as well as small businesses and family-run firms.
“Our client philosophy is simple. We stand by our values of personalized customer service, quality products, reasonable expenses and always doing what is best for the client,” said Hotzler. “My family has owned businesses throughout my lifetime, so I’m excited to finally have a small business that I can share with my mother. We connect well with other family business clients, because it just speaks to where we’ve come from and what we’ve been doing for generations.”
Why ProsperLane Financial chose LPL
Looking for improved technology offerings to provide an elevated client experience and the counsel and support to create a succession plan for ProsperLane, the team turned to LPL after an extensive due diligence process.
“I chose LPL after a lengthy review of options available to me and my son. I wanted to build a multigenerational financial services office which would allow us to work together as a team and expand our services to our clients,” said Johnston. “We want to grow and have additional staff who have expertise in tax, accounting and legal fields. LPL gives us powerful resources and the freedom to support our growth, our way.”
Scott Posner, Managing Director, Business Development, said, “We welcome Sheri and Jason to LPL. LPL offers innovative technology and the strategic support advisors can use to deliver differentiated client experiences. We look forward to supporting the team as they continue to grow and support families in the Minneapolis area.”
Related
Advisors, learn how LPL Financial can help take your business to the next level.
About LPL Financial
LPL Financial Holdings Inc. (Nasdaq: LPLA) is among the fastest growing wealth management firms in the U.S. As a leader in the financial advisor-mediated marketplace, LPL supports over 29,000 financial advisors and the wealth management practices of approximately 1,200 financial institutions, servicing and custodying approximately www.lpl.com.
Securities and advisory services offered through LPL Financial LLC (“LPL Financial”), a registered investment advisor and broker-dealer, member FINRA/SIPC. ProsperLane Financial and LPL Financial are separate entities.
Throughout this communication, the terms “financial advisors” and “advisors” are used to refer to registered representatives and/or investment advisor representatives affiliated with LPL Financial.
We routinely disclose information that may be important to shareholders in the “Investor Relations” or “Press Releases” section of our website.
*Value approximated based on asset and holding details provided to LPL from end of year, 2024.
Media Contact: Media.relations@LPLFinancial.com

author: Paul MacInnes
title: Not-so-secret weapon: world’s second-tallest man leads Iran into sitting volleyball final – The Irish Times
text: When the decisive spike smashed off the Egyptian defence to seal Iranian victory in their sitting volleyball semi-final it was fitting it should be delivered by Morteza Mehrzad; their not-so secret weapon, he is also the world’s second-tallest man. Mehrzad, 36, is 8ft 1in tall. He was born with gigantism and also uses a wheelchair after a bike accident as a teenager caused an injury that stopped his right leg from growing. When the ball is served in his sport he must push his head down to keep it under the cord of the net. When he arrived at the Paralympic village in Paris he was forced to sleep on the floor because there was no bed big enough for him. He is shy, disliking the attention his condition brings, and when he plays on the court he rarely smiles. You could be forgiven for feeling sorry for him. And yet, when his coach Hadi Rezaei talks about Mehrzad, he says that working with him has been “one of the most important things I have done during my whole life”. And it is Mehrzad who will bring the attention of the Iranian nation, and of a global audience too, to this sport and the final against Bosnia and Herzegovina on Friday. [Paralympics: Complete day-by-day guide to the Irish athletes in action in Paris](/sport/2024/08/26/paralympics-complete-day-by-day-guide-to-the-irish-athletes-in-action-in-paris/) [Not-so-secret weapon: world’s second-tallest man leads Iran into sitting volleyball final](/sport/2024/09/05/not-so-secret-weapon-worlds-second-tallest-man-leads-iran-into-sitting-volleyball-final/) [Róisín Ní Riain ‘disappointed’ as she misses out on third Paralympics medal](/sport/2024/09/05/roisin-ni-riain-disappointed-as-she-misses-out-on-third-paralympics-medal/) [Bed found for 8ft 1 Iranian Paralympian forced to sleep on floor in Paris](/sport/2024/09/05/bed-found-for-8ft-1-iranian-paralympian-forced-to-sleep-on-floor-in-paris/) While he may not smile much, there is no doubting the passion Mehrzad has for his sport; in the decisive fourth set of a 3-1 victory, he dominated play and celebrated each point he scored with two pumping fists. This is Rezaei’s seventh Paralympic Games as the coach of the Iranian sitting volleyball team, leading them to four gold medals in that time. He was also a player before that, winning gold three times in Seoul, Barcelona and Atlanta. So the legend has it, he learned of Mehrzad and his exceptional height after the young man featured in a programme on Iranian TV. Rezaei reached out to him and encouraged him to try out sitting volleyball. Mehrzad, Rezaei says, had been living in seclusion. “He had been isolated from the population,” he says. “I was able to bring him into society.” Mehrzad developed his skills under Rezaei’s tutelage and duly became a potent ingredient in Iran’s recurring success. An outside hitter, it is Mehrzad’s job to finish off the fast-paced, intricate passing moves that are a requirement of the sport. He has the awareness and the power, and his height gives him leverage. Since coming into the Iranian squad for the Rio Games, he has won two gold medals, with a chance of a third on Friday. Rezaei chose to rotate his star player in and out of the side in the semi-final, conscious of protecting him against injury. That said, Iran are hardly a one-man band and neither are they short on players of grand stature. The way the Egyptian players celebrated every point they won showed how much respect they had for their opponents. Iran now face rivals Bosnia and Herzegovina, a team they defeated in the final of the world championships two years ago. “I would like to let you know that tomorrow all people all around the world will be able to watch one of the most important games,” Rezaei said. “The disabled athletes will be able to show their ability and capability, and let’s see what they can do. But if I win the match or am just a finalist it will be my great pleasure to be there, I will be more than happy.” The issue of Mehrzad’s bed also appears to have been resolved. In Tokyo Mehrzad had a bed custom-made for him but, in Paris, IPC officials had told the Iranian team that they would instead provide extensions to a standard athlete’s bed. This proved insufficient and resulted in Mehrzad sleeping on the floor. Rezaei insisted his athlete would cope despite the conditions, but it provoked media interest and it appears that an enquiry by the BBC children’s programme Newsround led the IPC to return to the problem. After the semi-final, Rezaei was able to confirm that his star now has a bed that fits him. “The problem has been solved,” he said.
